meanings.definition: Inflammation of the mucous membrane in the nose, causing a runny nose and nasal congestion.
meanings.sent1: The doctor diagnosed him with coryzas after examining his stuffy nose.
meanings.sent2: During flu season, many people suffer from coryzas and seek relief.
meanings.sent3: The coryzas made his voice sound funny, like he was speaking through a trumpet.
meanings.sent4: Her coryzas were like a traffic jam in her nose, causing discomfort.
meanings.sent5: The coryzas turned his tissue into a soggy mess, reminding him to rest and recover.

meanings.definition: A contagious viral infection of the upper respiratory tract, typically causing symptoms such as sneezing and coughing.
meanings.sent1: The school nurse sent him home due to coryzas to prevent spreading the infection.
meanings.sent2: Coryzas can spread quickly in crowded places like schools and offices.
meanings.sent3: His exaggerated sneezes during coryzas made his friends laugh uncontrollably.
meanings.sent4: The coryzas swept through the office like a gust of wind, affecting everyone.
meanings.sent5: The severity of her coryzas made her realize the importance of good hygiene practices.
